gurmukhi: Awgy kI sYn BjI jb hI qb paurK sRI biRjrwj sMBwrXo ]TwFo jhwN dl ko piq hY qhwN jwie prXo icq bIc ibcwrXo ]
transliteration: Ooge Kisain Bhajijab Hitab Paurakh Sribrijraaj Sanbhdaryo|| Thaadho Jahaan Dal Ko Pa(i) Hai Tahaan Jaae Daryo Chit Beech Bichdaryo||
translation: When the confronging army fled, Krishna in extreme anger sustained his strength and thinking in his mind, he reached there, where the general of the army was standing;

gurmukhi: SsqR sMBwr murwr sBY niRp TwFo jhw iqh Er isDwrXo ]bwn kmwn ghI Gin sXwm jrwisMD ko AiBmwn auqwrXo ]1743]
transliteration: Shastra Sanbhaar Muraar Sabhai Nrip Thaadho Jahaa Tih Or Sidhdaryo|| Baan Kamaan Gadighan(i) Syaam Jaraasindh Ko Abhimaan Outdaryo||1743||
translation: Holding his weapons, Krishna reached that place, where the king Jarasandh was standing, he held his bow and arrows and pulversied the ego of Jarasandh.1743.

gurmukhi: sRI blbIr srwsn qy jb qIr Cuty qb ko ThrwvY ]jwie lgy ijh ky aur mY sr so iCn mY jm Dwm isDwvY ]
transliteration: Sribalbeer Saraasan Te Jab Teer Chhoute Tab Ko Thahraavai|| Jae Lage Jih Ke Ur Mai Sar So Chhin Mai Jam Dhaam Sidhaavai||
translation: When the arrows were discharged from the bow of Krishna, who could then stand against him? Those who were hit by these arrows, they reached the abode of Yama in an instant;

gurmukhi: AYso n ko pRgitE jg mY Bt jo smuhwie kY juDu mcwvY ]BUpq kau injbIr khY hir mwrq sYn clXo rn AwvY ]1744]
transliteration: Aiso Na Ko Pragtio Jag Mai Bhat Jo Samuhaae Kai Judh(u) Machaavai|| Bhoopat Kau Nijbeer Kahai Har(i) Maarat Sain Chadyo Ran Aavai||1744||
translation: No such warrior has been born, who could fight in front of Krishna; the warriors of the king said to him, “Krishna is coming alongwith his army in order to kill us.”1744.

gurmukhi: sXwm kI Er qy bwn Cuty niRp ky dl ky bhu bIrn Gwey ]jyiqk Awie iBry hir so iCn bIc qyaU jmDwm pTwey ]
transliteration: Syaam Kior Te Baan Chhoute Nrip Ke Dal Ke Bahu Bderan Ghaae|| Jetik Aae Bhire Har(i) So Chhin Beech Teoo Jamdhaam Pathaae||
translation: Many warriors on the side of the king were killed, when the arrows were discharged from the side of Krishna; those who fought with Krishna, reached the abode of Yama;

gurmukhi: kauqik dyiK kY XO rn mY Aiq Awqur huie iqn bYn sunwey ]Awvn dyhu AbY hm kau niRp AYsy kihE isgry smJwey ]1745]
transliteration: Kaoutak(i) Dekh(i) Kai You Ran Mai At(i) Aatur Hue Tin Bain Sounaae|| Oovan Dehu Abai Ham Kau Nrip Aise Kahio Sigre Samjhaae||1745||
translation: Seeing this spectacle, the king god agitated and told and instructed his warriors, “Let Krishna near me, then I shall see.”1745.

gurmukhi: BUp lKXo hir Awvq hI sMg lY pRqnw qb Awp hI DwXo ]Awgy kIey inj log sBY qb lY kir ko br sMK bjwXo ]
transliteration: Bhoop Lakhhyo Har(i) Aavat Hisan Lai Pratnaa Tab Aap Hidhaayo|| Ooge Keee Nij Log Sabhai Tab Lai Kar(i) Ko Bar Sankh Bajaayo||
translation: When the king saw Krishna coming, he marched forward alongwith his army; he caused his warriors to advance and taking up his conch in his hand, he blew it;

gurmukhi: sXwm BnY iqh Awhv mY Aiq hI mn BIqr ko fr pwXo ]qw Duin ko suin kY br bIrn ky icq mwnhu cwau bFwXo ]1746]
transliteration: Syaam Bhanai Tih Aahav Mai At(i) Himan Bheetar Ko Dar Paayo|| Taa Dhoun(i) Ko Soun(i) Kai Bar Bderan Ke Chit Maanoh Chaao Bdhaayo||1746||
translation: The poet says that there is no fear in the mind of anyone in the war; hearing the sound of the conch, the minds of the warriors were excited.1746.

gurmukhi: jrwisMD kI Aiq cmUM aumfI kRoD bFwie ]DnuK bwn hir pwn lY iCn mY dInI Gwie ]1747]
transliteration: Jaraasindh Kiat(i) Chamoond Oumdikrodh Badhaae|| Dhanoukh Baan Har(i) Paan Lai Chhin Mai Deenighaae||1747||
translation: The fourfold army of Jarasandh rushed forward, but Krishna taking his bow and arrows in his hand destroyed all in an instant.1747.
